text: Etelka Keserű (née Bérci; 26 August 1925 – 1 April 2018) was a Hungarian economist and politician. He served as Minister of Light Industry between 1971 and 1980. Keserű died in Budapest on 1 April 2018 of cardiopulmonary arrest at the age of 92. ==References== Category:1925 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from cardiopulmonary arrest Category:Hungarian politicians Category:Hungarian economists
title: Etelka Keserű
